verses.verse: And afterward<WH310> Moses<WH4872> and Aaron<WH175> went in<WH935>, and told<WH559> Pharaoh<WH6547>, Thus saith<WH559> the LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>, Let my people<WH5971> go<WH7971>, that they may hold a feast<WH2287> unto me in the wilderness<WH4057>.

And Pharaoh<WH6547> said<WH559>, Who is the LORD<WH3068>, that I should obey<WH8085> his voice<WH6963> to let Israel<WH3478> go<WH7971>? I know<WH3045> not the LORD<WH3068>, neither will I let Israel<WH3478> go<WH7971>.

And they said<WH559>, The God<WH430> of the Hebrews<WH5680> hath met<WH7122> with us: let us go<WH3212>, we pray thee, three<WH7969> days'<WH3117> journey<WH1870> into the desert<WH4057>, and sacrifice<WH2076> unto the LORD<WH3068> our God<WH430>; lest he fall<WH6293> upon us with pestilence<WH1698>, or with the sword<WH2719>.

And the king<WH4428> of Egypt<WH4714> said<WH559> unto them, Wherefore do ye, Moses<WH4872> and Aaron<WH175>, let<WH6544> the people<WH5971> from their works<WH4639>? get<WH3212> you unto your burdens<WH5450>.
And Pharaoh<WH6547> said<WH559>, Behold, the people<WH5971> of the land<WH776> now are many<WH7227>, and ye make them rest<WH7673> from their burdens<WH5450>.
And Pharaoh<WH6547> commanded<WH6680> the same day<WH3117> the taskmasters<WH5065> of the people<WH5971>, and their officers<WH7860>, saying<WH559>,

Ye shall no more<WH3254> give<WH5414> the people<WH5971> straw<WH8401> to make<WH3835> brick<WH3843>, as heretofore<WH8032> <WH8543>: let them go<WH3212> and gather<WH7197> straw<WH8401> for themselves.

And the tale<WH4971> of the bricks<WH3843>, which they did make<WH6213> heretofore<WH8032> <WH8543>, ye shall lay<WH7760> upon them; ye shall not diminish<WH1639> ought thereof: for they be idle<WH7503>; therefore they cry<WH6817>, saying<WH559>, Let us go<WH3212> and sacrifice<WH2076> to our God<WH430>.

Let there more work<WH5656> be laid<WH3513> upon the men<WH582>, that they may labour<WH6213> therein; and let them not regard<WH8159> vain<WH8267> words<WH1697>. Let there: Heb. Let the work be heavy upon the men

And the taskmasters<WH5065> of the people<WH5971> went out<WH3318>, and their officers<WH7860>, and they spake<WH559> to the people<WH5971>, saying<WH559>, Thus saith<WH559> Pharaoh<WH6547>, I will not give<WH5414> you straw<WH8401>.
Go<WH3212> ye, get<WH3947> you straw<WH8401> where<WH834> ye can find<WH4672> it: yet<WH3588> not ought<WH1697> of your work<WH5656> shall be diminished<WH1639>.
So the people<WH5971> were scattered abroad<WH6327> throughout all the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714> to gather<WH7197> stubble<WH7179> instead of straw<WH8401>.

And the taskmasters<WH5065> hasted<WH213> them, saying<WH559>, Fulfil<WH3615> your works<WH4639>, your daily<WH3117> tasks<WH1697>, as when there was<WH1961> straw<WH8401>. your daily: Heb. a matter of a day in his day

And the officers<WH7860> of the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>, which Pharaoh's<WH6547> taskmasters<WH5065> had set<WH7760> over them, were beaten<WH5221>, and demanded<WH559>, Wherefore have ye not fulfilled<WH3615> your task<WH2706> in making brick<WH3835> both yesterday<WH8543> and to day<WH3117>, as heretofore<WH8032> <WH8543>?
Then the officers<WH7860> of the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> came<WH935> and cried<WH6817> unto Pharaoh<WH6547>, saying<WH559>, Wherefore dealest<WH6213> thou thus with thy servants<WH5650>?

There is no straw<WH8401> given<WH5414> unto thy servants<WH5650>, and they say<WH559> to us, Make<WH6213> brick<WH3843>: and, behold, thy servants<WH5650> are beaten<WH5221>; but the fault<WH2398> is in thine own people<WH5971>.
But he said<WH559>, Ye are idle<WH7503>, ye are idle<WH7503>: therefore ye say<WH559>, Let us go<WH3212> and do sacrifice<WH2076> to the LORD<WH3068>.
Go<WH3212> therefore now, and work<WH5647>; for there shall no straw<WH8401> be given<WH5414> you, yet shall ye deliver<WH5414> the tale<WH8506> of bricks<WH3843>.

And the officers<WH7860> of the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> did see<WH7200> that they were in evil<WH7451> case, after it was said<WH559>, Ye shall not minish<WH1639> ought from your bricks<WH3843> of your daily<WH3117> <WH3117> task<WH1697>.
And they met<WH6293> Moses<WH4872> and Aaron<WH175>, who stood<WH5324> in the way<WH7125>, as they came forth<WH3318> from Pharaoh<WH6547>:

And they said<WH559> unto them, The LORD<WH3068> look<WH7200> upon you, and judge<WH8199>; because ye have made our savour<WH7381> to be abhorred<WH887> in the eyes<WH5869> of Pharaoh<WH6547>, and in the eyes<WH5869> of his servants<WH5650>, to put<WH5414> a sword<WH2719> in their hand<WH3027> to slay<WH2026> us. to be: Heb. to stink
And Moses<WH4872> returned<WH7725> unto the LORD<WH3068>, and said<WH559>, Lord<WH136>, wherefore hast thou so evil entreated<WH7489> this people<WH5971>? why is it that thou hast sent<WH7971> me?

For since I came<WH935> to Pharaoh<WH6547> to speak<WH1696> in thy name<WH8034>, he hath done evil<WH7489> to this people<WH5971>; neither hast thou delivered<WH5337> thy people<WH5971> at all<WH5337>. neither: Heb. delivering thou hast not delivered
